intro: Malleola honhoffii, commonly known as the African bellflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, bell-like blooms. Malleola honhoffii is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
